title: God's Justice and Refuge
shortSummary: Psalm 94 is a passionate plea for God's righteous judgment against the wicked who oppress His people. It emphasizes God's omniscience, justice, and faithfulness as the refuge for the righteous amid adversity. The psalm encourages trust in God's discipline and His ultimate vindication of His people.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, attributed to David

keyCharacters.name: The Psalmist
keyCharacters.description: Traditionally King David, who voices a heartfelt cry for God's justice and protection against evildoers.

keyCharacters.name: The Wicked
keyCharacters.description: Oppressors and workers of iniquity who afflict God's people and challenge His justice.

keyCharacters.name: The Righteous
keyCharacters.description: God's faithful people who suffer under the oppression but find refuge and comfort in Him.

definitions.definition: God's righteous act of punishing the wicked and defending His people.
To discipline or correct, often by God, for the purpose of teaching and growth.
God's chosen people or inheritance, often referring to Israel.
A metaphor for destruction or judgment prepared for the wicked.

outline.heading: A Cry for Divine Vengeance and Justice
outline.description: The psalmist calls on God as the righteous judge to arise and punish the proud wicked who oppress the vulnerable and deny God's awareness of their deeds.

outline.heading: God’s Omniscience and the Folly of the Wicked
outline.description: A rebuke to the foolish who doubt God's knowledge and justice, affirming that God hears, sees, and understands all human thoughts and actions.

outline.heading: Blessing Through God’s Discipline
outline.description: The psalmist highlights the blessing of God's correction, which leads to rest and righteousness, assuring that God will not abandon His people.

outline.heading: A Personal Plea for Help and Assurance of God’s Protection
outline.description: The psalmist expresses dependence on God’s help in times of weakness and finds comfort in His mercy amid many anxious thoughts.

outline.heading: God’s Judgment on the Wicked and Refuge for the Righteous
outline.description: The psalm concludes with a declaration that God will bring justice by repaying the wicked according to their deeds, while being a steadfast refuge for the righteous.

application: Trust God as the righteous judge who will ultimately bring justice, even when the wicked seem to triumph.
Embrace God’s discipline as a sign of His love and a means to grow in wisdom and righteousness.
Find comfort and refuge in God during times of adversity and mental distress by relying on His mercy and faithfulness.
Stand firm in faith, knowing God sees all and will defend the innocent against evil.

keyVerses.text: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O LORD, and teachest him out of thy law;
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the blessing found in God's discipline and instruction, encouraging believers to accept correction as part of spiritual growth.

keyVerses.text: For the LORD will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.
keyVerses.significance: It assures believers of God's unfailing commitment to His people, providing hope and security amid trials.

keyVerses.text: But the LORD is my defence; and my God is the rock of my refuge.
keyVerses.significance: This verse powerfully expresses the psalmist’s confidence in God as a protector and refuge in times of trouble.

keyVerses.text: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the LORD our God shall cut them off.
keyVerses.significance: It affirms God's perfect justice in punishing the wicked according to their deeds, reinforcing the certainty of divine retribution.
